title: FIFA 14 cso + jpcsp emulator - PSP Rip
description:
Hi football games fans ...

Play the new FIFA on the PSP or in the PC with the jpcsp emulator (TESTED) ...

RIPPED : only commentarys inside the game , the rest is intact


Features
Ignite Engine
Bundesliga clubs Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich in FIFA 13 (above) and FIFA 14 (below).

A new engine called the Ignite Engine will be used in FIFA 14 on the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One versions only. This features both graphical and game-play changes such as Human Intelligence to make players react more like the real thing, True Player Motion to create more realistic movement from the players and more realism to the way environmental features like weather and stadium crowd dynamics develop during play.[9] A PC port of the version with Ignite Engine was in the works, but eventually it was cancelled.
Licenses

21 Brazilian clubs are licensed: all 20 from the 2013 Campeonato Brasileiro SÃƒÂ©rie A season as well as Palmeiras. FIFA 14 will also include Chile's Campeonato Nacional Petrobras, Colombia's Liga PostobÃƒÂ³n and the Argentine Primera DivisiÃƒÂ³n. The Brazil national football team has also been licensed after not being licensed since FIFA 10. Upon announcement that Robert Lewandowski was to appear on the Polish cover of FIFA 14, it was also announced that the Poland national football team was to be fully licensed, alongside the Ekstraklasa in FIFA 14, as they had not been in previous games of the FIFA series. The Wales national football team will return in FIFA 14 according to Football Association of Wales commercial director, Ian Davis, who confirmed that theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve reached an agreement with EA that will see Wales represented in future versions of the game.[citation needed]
Ultimate Team


Stadiums

In FIFA 14, experience the world of football with over 60 stadiums, including 32 real-world venues, with new additions including La Bombonera in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Goodison Park; England's first purpose-built football stadium[19] and the Donbass Arena in the Ukraine, home of Shaktar Donetsk, in addition to the return of Barcelona's Camp Nou, which was removed from FIFA 13 due to licensing reasons.
